articles.title: Best news stories 2021-09-10 - Phys.Org
articles.content: Don't miss a beat! Here are yesterday's top stories

articles.author: Geoff Lemon
articles.title: AFL 2021 preliminary final: Melbourne Demons v Geelong Cats – live! - The Guardian
articles.description: Goal-by-goal report: Who will claim victory in Perth and make it to the 2021 grand final? Find out with Geoff Lemon
articles.content: Shall we prepare to rumble? Nothing thrills the soul like the word preliminary, and here we are - the prelim finals for the AFL season of 2021. Another season of wildly fluctuating schedules, last-mi… [+1110 chars]

articles.title: Moth Wingtips Structured To Reflect Sound: An “Acoustic Decoy” To Thwart Bat Attack - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Wingtips of certain species of silkmoth are structured to reflect sound and throw off attackers, according to a new study. Researchers at the University of Bristol have discovered that the tips of some saturniid moth forewings are curiously rippled and folded…
articles.content: The Atlas moth (Attacus atlas) has a strong anti-bat acoustic decoy at the tip of its forewings. Composite image with photograph on right half and acoustic tomography on the left. Colour indicates ec… [+4725 chars]

articles.title: "Balaji Kurkure": Mumbai Ex Cop's FaceTime ID Part Of Ambani Bomb Scare Probe - NDTV

articles.content:
The ID on Param Bir Singh's iPhone was created in April, the NIA is reported to have been told..

articles.description: An experimental New Zealand team look to end the T20 series on a high with a victory in the final match in Dhaka.
articles.content:
The Black Caps take on Bangladesh in the fifth T20 international at Dhakas Shere Bangla National Stadium.
Shamsul Haque Tanku/Photosport

articles.author: Bianca Hall
articles.title: Ultra-Orthodox prayer group has breached lockdowns since last year - The Age
articles.description: Some ultra-Orthodox Jewish worshippers – many from the strictly conservative Satmar sect – have been gathering since March last year during repeated lockdowns, to the frustration of police, Victoria’s Department of Health and the wider Jewish community.
articles.content:
The ultra-Orthodox Adass Israel Synagogue, headquartered around the corner on Glen Eira Avenue, issued a statement distancing itself from the event.
Adass Israel congregation was not responsible for… [+3457 chars]

articles.description: The asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter was formed amid formation of our solar system. Whatever material was left after formation of the Sun and the planets was scattered in form of asteroids. Many of them have an orbit that makes them zoom past Earth in c…

articles.author: Jan M. Olsen | AP
articles.title: Citing high shot rates, Danes end COVID-19 restriction - The Washington Post
articles.description: Denmark’s high vaccination rate has enabled the Scandinavian country to become one of the first European Union nations to lift all domestic COVID-19 restrictions
articles.content:
More than 80% of people above the age of 12 have had the two shots.
I wouldnt say it is too early. We have opened the door but we have also said that we can close it if needed, Soeren Riis Paludan, … [+4225 chars]

articles.author: Jacob Paul
articles.title: UK TSUNAMI warning as Greenland landslide threatens disaster: 'Britain's in line of fire!' - Daily Express
articles.description: AN EXPERT has warned that disaster could strike the UK as melting ice sheets in Greenland threaten to trigger a tsunami - and Britain is said to be 'in the line of fire'.
